title: Scientific Paper Visualization Expression
content:
As a research graphic design expert, you need to create a graphical abstract for an SCI paper on [research topic] that meets the submission requirements of the [target SCI journal]. The specific requirements are as follows:  

1. Content Structure  
- Research Model: Use diagrams or flowcharts to illustrate the core research framework  
- Experimental Process: Present key experimental processes through timelines or step-by-step diagrams  
- Core Results: Display major findings using comparative charts or data visualizations  
- Innovative Conclusions: Highlight research breakthroughs with prominent icons or text boxes  

2. Visual Design Standards  
- Use infographic, flowchart, or cartoon-style diagrams for visual expression  
- Apply the three-color principle (primary color + secondary color + accent color) to enhance visual hierarchy  
- Use a unified icon system and line style  
- Maintain alignment and proportional coordination of graphic elements  

3. Text Standards  
- Font: Use sans-serif fonts (e.g., Arial or Helvetica)  
- Font Size: Title 36pt, body text 18-24pt  
- Color: Ensure sufficient contrast between text and background  
- Language: Use concise academic phrases, avoid complex sentence structures  

4. Technical Parameters  
- Size: Strictly follow the journal's requirements (usually 500×700 pixels or 12×18 cm)  
- Format: Submit in PDF/A or TIFF format (300dpi)  
- Resolution: Ensure clarity and distinguishability of graphic elements  
- File Naming: Name according to the journal's required format (e.g., Figure1_GA.pdf)  

5. Design Standards  
- Information Density: Include 3-5 key information units per square centimeter  
- Visual Focus: Guide the visual flow through color contrast and spatial layout  
- Professionalism: Meet the academic aesthetic standards of SCI journals  
- Portability: Ensure consistent display effects across different devices  

The graphical abstract needs to be completed within

title: Web UI Prototype Generator
content:
As a product manager and UI designer, complete the following interface prototype design tasks:  
1. User Experience Analysis  
   - Analyze the app's core features and user needs  
   - Determine key interaction logic and user flows  
   - Identify main user scenarios and operation paths  

2. Product Interface Planning  
   - Define key interface components  
   - Build an information architecture model  
   - Design user operation flowcharts  
   - Ensure clear interface hierarchy and smooth navigation  

3. High-Fidelity UI Design  
   - Follow 10S design guidelines (Human Interface Guidelines)  
   - Use card-based layouts and rounded corner elements  
   - Add appropriate shadow effects  
   - Maintain a modern and simple visual style  
   - Include standard status bar and bottom navigation bar (Home/Widgets/Settings)  

4. HTML Prototype Implementation  
   - Use HTML + Tailwind CSS to build the interface  
   - Implement basic interactive functions (page navigation/form operations/data simulation)  
   - Separate code files into HTML/CSS/JS  
   - Save each interface as an independent HTML file (home.html/profile.html/settings.html, etc.)  
   - Create index.html as the main entry point  
   - Use iframe to embed interface fragments  
   - Support navigation between interfaces  
   - Can be opened independently for a complete experience  

5. Realism Enhancement Requirements  
   - Simulate the interface size of iPhone 16 Pro Max  
   - Apply 20px rounded corners  
   - Use professional icon libraries (Font Awesome/Material Icons)  
   - Reference CDN resources  
   - Choose images related to the application theme  
   - Obtain free materials from Unsplash/Pexels  
   - Ensure a unified overall visual style  
   - Use 10S standard components (date picker/switch/list styles)

2. Design the initial question: Pose an open-ended question to reveal the other person's basic position
3. Apply the method of questioning: Through continuous questioning, reveal contradictions and ambiguities within the concept
4. Guide logical deduction: Help the interlocutor discover logical flaws in their views
5. Explore alternative explanations: Present different perspectives to expand the dimensions of thinking

For the request "exploring the concept of justice from an ethical perspective," please develop the dialogue according to the above framework. Maintain the heuristic and critical nature of the questions, avoiding directly providing answers or pre-established positions.
